Combat: Seeing that the title is Elusive; I think combat should be focused on dodging and jumping mechanics.

Since Elusives are hidden from us maybe the boss fights could be "stages" and use parts of the environment (or the body of the boss, think sneaking around to "itch" their head and they smack themselves or guiding them to "ropes" that causes the boss to fall/ trap themelves) to take them down vs a full frontal attack with blocking and parry mechanics.

Regular combat could be a method of stunning the "enemies" with a staff or could leave "food" to distract them and find a peaeful way around them. If use this method, then next tiem in the area the "enemies" become friendly to you with little emoticons to the main character.
I feel like Elusives would not want to terrorize their ecosystem...literally off the top of my head (but if you need help designing let me know lol)

Hi! We're glad to see that some of your ideas coincide with the approach we had already taken for combat in Elusive. That means we are on the right track hehe Thank you very much for your suggestions and support!
Hi! Not for now, sorry. Thank you for supporting us!

A souls-lite combat with invisibility frames for dodging would be on part with the theme of the story. Having to fight spiders and others kinds of insects would be interesting and having bosses of those same species but bigger.
Very interesting suggestion, thank you so much! :D
